Assuming `I` to be a grayscale image, you can use **[`histc`][1]** to get `H` -

    H = sum(histc(I,0:255),2)


  [1]: http://www.mathworks.in/help/matlab/ref/histc.html

Assuming `I` to be a grayscale image, you can use **[`histc`][1]** to get `H` -

    H = sum(histc(I,0:255),2)

Thus, the complete code would be -

    % read image
    I = imread(im);
    H = sum(histc(I,0:255),2)


  [1]: http://www.mathworks.in/help/matlab/ref/histc.html

Assuming `I` to be a grayscale image, you can use **[`histc`][1]** to get `H` -

    H = sum(histc(I,0:255),2)

Thus, the complete code would be -

    % read image
    I = imread(im);
    H = sum(histc(I,0:255),2)

----

If you were looking for a little less-advanced code, you can avoid one nested loop -

    % read image
    I = imread(im);
    H = zeros(256,1);
    
    % loop for checking values
    for GrayValue = 0:255
        for i = 1:numel(I)
            if I(i) == GrayValue % read each pixel coordinate
                H(GrayValue+1) = H(GrayValue+1)+1;
            end
        end
    end


  [1]: http://www.mathworks.in/help/matlab/ref/histc.html
